ADESA Des Moines kicked off the holiday season with an Ugly Sweater sale. More than a dozen employees wore their best ugly sweater, and Title Clerk Jodi won the $200 gift card.
WHY on Earth would someone no call / no show for an interview?
(Seriously, let's get creative with our theories!)
In the 24 hours between my discussing the interview with the candidate and the time when the interview was scheduled to occur the next day... POOF! Disappeared.
1) He won the lottery! Had a legendary Outback Steakhouse bender and slept it off
2) Had the best Tinder date of his life, eloped to Vegas!
3) He got another job AND lost his phone AND experienced a power outage at home, so he couldn't let me know
Ultimately, it was none of the above. Days later he returned my call. Because he was interested in a DIFFERENT job. He decided the commute was too far for this one.
Shockingly, I'm not recommending him for the other job.
I mean, the manager had carved time out of his busy day.
Candidate burned his proverbial bridge with my agency, the company he was supposed to interview at, AND the company he was interested in. Impressive trifecta.
Is there ANY acceptable excuse (again, feel free to speculate wildly!!!) for not calling / emailing  / messaging / texting to cancel?
Job seekers, can you shed some light on the thought process of doing this in such a competitive market? And tell the truth, never have you EVER NCNS-ed?

Play a key role in the performance of yearly HUD, Regulation AB and USAP audits. Compliance audits will include testing of compliance and related control environment. Working directly with Business Process Owners and External Audit, all audits are conducted in a dynamic environment to assess compliance with regulations and industry benchmarks; effectiveness of controls; accuracy of reporting; and operational efficiency. MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES •	Perform audits in support of external auditors. •	Completes audit process to ensure compliance audits are thoroughly executed within established time frames with appropriate follow-up and closure. •	Develops the audit programs to evaluate processes for effectiveness of controls, efficiency, accuracy of reporting and compliance to established procedures. •	Perform audit procedures to evaluate design and adequacy of internal controls. Ensure appropriate controls are in place to prevent mismanagement, non-adherence to regulatory/industry benchmarks, waste and fraud. •	Analyze, prepare, and document results (exhibits, procedures, etc.) and assist in preparing audit reports to communicate the findings and recommendations to senior management. •	Ensure consistent communication with audit staff and management throughout the audit process. •	Prepare and present written and oral reports regarding findings and recommendations.

This position serves as the knowledge expert within the Sales team to increase customer confidence and Workiva's ability to provide superior solutions across multiple domains of expertise. The SOX SME directly interacts with customers and provides in-depth knowledge of the accounting and SOX reporting, along with Wdesk's ability to streamline reporting processes. This role addresses prospective customers' concerns or questions.

•	Assisted Management with implementation of new accounting standards •	Lead and manages a team of two Senior Internal Auditors and one Manager•	Lead SOX industry roundtable •	Maintained communication and positive relationships with various Accounting and Finance process owners, global Internal Audit team, and External Audit team•	Assisted in Timeshare Spinoff activities •	Assisted in Genpact transition •	Managed SOX activities including: narratives, walkthroughs, test of control, and evaluation of results•	Managed control self-assessment survey •	Assisted in COSO 2013 implementation •	Developed and prepared Division narratives and walkthroughs •	Developed and prepared Hotel narratives and walkthroughs •	Developed and lead multiple Corporate audits including: Executive Aircraft, Travel and Entertainment, Digital Fees, Purchasing Card, Loyalty Program, Fund Accounting•	Lead Timeshare Assurance team

•	Performed Project Management of Sarbanes-Oxley Section 404 compliance•	Planned and scoped SOX activities for all entities•	Lead financial and compliance audit projects•	Acted as main contact for external auditors related to control evaluation •	Prepared periodic dashboard reporting to senior management summarizing SOX results•	Reviewed SSAE 16 reports, documented compliance with user considerations, and acceptance or additional procedures for identified exceptions•	Implemented electronic audit evidence program including: identification of system generated reports, development of audit procedures, and transition to management •	Assisted in SAP role redesign project •	Implement and lead SOX industry roundtable •	Managed control self-assessment survey •	Maintained communication and positive relationships with various Accounting and Finance process owners, global Internal Audit team, and External Audit team

•	Prepared and reviewed month end journal entries•	Prepared 6-8 sets of financial statements monthly•	Completed analysis of general ledger account fluctuations•	Completed and filed 11 sales and use tax returns monthly•	Prepared, completed, and analyzed balance sheet reconciliations•	Worked directly with Controller, CFO, and various General Managers to resolve accounting issues•	Provided accounting support to 10 full service hotels•	Performed cash reconciliations •	Lead multiple extensive hotel accounts receivable projects •	Maintained communication and positive relationships with hotels and their respective staff
